embed.title: Managing Tags
embed.description:
The `/managetags manage` command allows for you to create and edit tags, and `/managetags delete` allows for you to delete them. By default, these commands require Administrator permissions since they allow indirect access to your Deta Drive.
Users can invoke them using `/tag` and `/tags`
For example, you can delete this tag with `/managetags delete intro`

fields.name: Creating Embeds
fields.value: If your tag content starts with `{`, it will be assumed to be a JSON representation of a [discord interactions message](https://github.com/etrotta/deta-discord-interactions/blob/deta/deta_discord_interactions/models/message.py). If you want to build Embeds, I personally recommend using a website such as [Glitchii's embed builder](https://glitchii.github.io/embedbuilder/), exporting the JSON then using `/managetags manage` or directly uploading to the Deta Drive under `discord_tags`.

fields.name: Confused? Drop me a DM
fields.value: You can find me in the Deta discord server, in the Python Discord server or just send me a friend request: <@256442550683041793> ~~*offer available for a limited time~~

fields.name: Why does this tag keeps coming back after being deleted?
fields.value:
Some default tags are created when you visit `example.deta.app/setup`.
You should only have to visit it one time after installing or updating environment variables though.
Aditionally, you can edit the `TAGS_SETTINGS` environment variable to stop setting the default tags on setup, by setting it to 1 ('read only') or 3 (read + allow editing via /managetags).
